greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle whose n-th row is list of numbers that are infinitarily relatively prime to n (n=2,3,..).
comment: The integers less than n that have no common infinitary divisors with n.
example: irelprime[6]={1, 4, 5} because iDivisors[6]={1, 2, 3, 6} and iDivisors[4]={1, 4} so 4 is infinitary_relatively_prime to 6 since it lacks common infinitary divisors with 6.
mathematica: irelprime[ n_ ] := Select[ temp=iDivisors[ n ]; Range[ n ], Intersection[ iDivisors[ # ], temp ]==={1}& ]; (* with iDivisors of n as *) bitty[ k_ ] := Union[ Flatten[ Outer[ Plus, Sequence@@{0, #1}&/@Union[ 2^Range[ 0, Floor[ Log[ 2, k ] ] ]*Reverse[ IntegerDigits[ k, 2 ] ] ] ] ] ]; iDivisors[ k_Integer ] := Sort[ (Times @@(First[ it ]^(#1/.z-> List))&)/@Flatten[ Outer[ z, Sequence@@bitty/@Last[ it=Transpose[ FactorInteger[ k ] ] ], 1 ] ] ]; iDivisors[ 1 ] := {1};
results.author: _Wouter Meeussen_, Sep 27 2001
